text: What is the purpose of this site?
answer: This site is part of a project to improve the voting experience for voters across the United States. This election cycle, we are piloting a program for reporting wait times to voters in Fulton County, GA. We hope this site will help you be more informed about the current wait times at your polling location.

text: How can I use this site?
answer:
This site will become active on election day: November 3rd, 2020. On that day, you will be able to search for any polling location in Fulton County and, if we are collecting data for that location, see what the currently reported wait time is. 
We will be collecting wait times for most, but not all, polling locations in Fulton County.
Please keep in mind that this is a pilot program. Your actual experience of waiting times may differ from what is posted.

text: How do I report a wait time?
answer: Wait times should only be reported from the polling location itself, and during the pilot program we are only accepting wait time reports from a subset of polling locations. At those locations, you will see a sign near the exit like the one below. If you see that sign, please send a text to the number provided with the number of minutes you waited in line to vote.

This project is a collaboration between [Georgia Institute of Technology](https://www.gatech.edu/) and Fulton County. It is funded with a grant from (The New Venture Fund)[https://newventurefund.org/] based out of Washington, DC.

text: Why is this project only for Fulton County?
answer: This project is part of a larger program to evaluate tools to improve the voting experience across the United States. This particular wait time project is being piloted in Fulton County, while other projects that are funded by a grant from (The New Venture Fund)[https://newventurefund.org/] are occurring in other locations.

text: How do you estimate the wait time?
answer: The current wait times you see on this site are a combination of reports from voters and observations made by members of our team. We combine every response we receive via text message and the observed times in a weighted average to produce the time shown on this site.

text: How do you protect my privacy?
answer:
When you submit a wait time via SMS texting, your phone number is not stored. 
When you fill out an online survey as part of this project, no identifying information is stored about you or the device you submitted it on.
Your participation in both of these activities is completely voluntary and anonymous.
